ETYMOLOGY: From Old French géographie, from Latin geōgraphia, from Ancient Greek γεωγραφία (geōgraphía, 'description of the earth'), from γῆ (gê, 'earth') + γράφω (gráphō, 'to write, to draw').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The study of the Earth's surface, physical features, climate, and population, including the interaction between humans and their environment.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 研究地球表面、物理特征、气候和人口，以及人类与其环境之间相互作用的学科。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She decided to major in geography because of her interest in different cultures and landscapes.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于对不同文化和地貌的兴趣，她决定主修地理学。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The physical characteristics, especially the surface features, of a particular place or region.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 特定地点或区域的物理特征，特别是其地表特征。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The difficult geography of the mountainous region made it challenging to build infrastructure.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该山区崎岖的地理环境给基础设施建设带来了挑战。
